Based on my analysis, the $MAGIC currency could be used as a store of value given it obtains the necessary network effect. 

Check out our Token Vault for more! 
https://t.co/ULstuD7miM

Game Studios have their own currency but each game they come out with has its own currency as well. This lowers the demand for the game studio's currency. See GALA Games for a perfect example of this. 

The only question is: how many people will join the Treasure ecosystem?

You will need the $MAGIC currency to use their ecosystem. It's the utility tokens for all of the different metaverses under its umbrella. This is an important difference from some of the game studios out there. https://t.co/cJKnQ8KGoR

https://t.co/3kLrfo6Y7H

...if you realize that you only use their partnered projects such as Alter, a messaging app, you need to buy the $ALTER currency, not $ATOM. 

The question is: do most people only use their ecosystem partners or do they use the services Cosmos provides?

The supply is inflationary in the long run due to its payment structure to stakers for validating the network. If you plan on using their service of interoperability, the $ATOM currency could be used as a store of value. It's important to note.. 2/3

$ATOM

Cosmos is designed to be an easy-to-use bridge across multiple blockchains. You need to purchase the $ATOM currency in order to use their service. 1/3 https://t.co/dOtaKmpwwH

"Fiat safe havens".. This just shows that most old rich people still don't understand #bitcoin. 

What's riskier: a currency with increasing demand and fixed supply or one with decreasing demand and inflationary supply?

@Cephii1 Tokenomics and network effect are the only things that matter. 
https://t.co/VoXcLceEev

I'll add: look at their price chart over the last month. $LUNA holder couldn't care less about global wars. The users are sitting in stable coins anyway and the ones holding $LUNA are earning passive from those using the stable coins. Just solid fundamentals. I don't even own any

You see a boom and bust of retail traders but an overall increase in network adoption. The question is: how large will their network effect get? 

Based on my analysis, the $LUNA currency could be used as a store of value given it obtains the necessary network effect.

They have an analytics page to see the inflationary/deflationary status of the $LUNA token. The design of their tokenomics structure is one of the best I've analyzed. Combine that with the number of users they have and the result you get is their price chart.

They have a few countries already on board. You need to burn the $LUNA currency to mint the stable coins. The transaction fees from using the stable coins on the network are paid to stakers in $LUNA tokens as a reward for validating transactions. https://t.co/bzocmPlX7O

@Matt_Tremolada I love your analysis. That's exactly the level of consideration I hope everyone takes when investing in a currency. As I said, the deciding factor for me was the fact that I don't use it. If I participated in the ecosystem, the currency would be a better store of value for me

@Matt_Tremolada I'll note, if you use the project, the score is a 76.8 and should be a "Do Your Own Research". Not using a project is at least a 10% factor when it comes to investing in the currencies associated with them.

@Matt_Tremolada Correct. But there is no way to know for sure if it will be deflationary. Once it has deflationary months, I'll redo the analysis. With transaction fees so low, it will be interesting to see how that plays out.

The supply has no limit and will increase at 5% yearly. With an increasing supply long term, the question is: how many non-developers will need to buy the $GLMR currency to use moonbeam?

For the projects who integrate with the Polkadot ecosystem using their service, the $GLMR currency will need to be purchased. This provides a certain level of natural demand for the currency. The deciding factor for me was that I don't plan on using the service. If you do, DYOR.

The question is: how large of a network effect can they build given their late start?

They're years behind on developer activity but could stand to have the better tech (who knows how $ETH 2.0 will play out). Their tokenomics are sound but remember the second part of the equation: network effect.
